content: how you want to sew the tail onto the animal page 5 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together all the puppy pieces laying out together start by sewing the head and body together using the tail you left earlier since you had 18 stitches at the end of the head and the body you should have no trouble sewing them together now you can shape the body a little now that it s attached to the head page 6 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com i like to put the arms on next put them a little forward of where human shoulders tend to be otherwise the arms look like they are behind the animal you can tell where to put them by the way the decreases you made in the head are at next comes legs i just start one in what looks to be the center of the body between the arms i sew the legs between the 4th and 5th row from the bottom of the body page 7 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com next comes the tail as with the legs sew the tail on between row 4 and 5 for me the tail rarely lays over the back seam i usually take better pictures of sewing on the ears so i apologize for this one you can hold the ears up to the head to see about where you want them to go but i usually put them at the 4th row from the center of the head your starting row page 8 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com you can kind of see ear placement in this one too next step is the face which i make using 2 strands of 4-ply yarn i separate out 2 strands from the 4 it gets kind of tangly when you do that but once you start sewing with it it s ok skye the dog page 9 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
